channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Summer classes shift to distance learning
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Distance learning will also be adopted in the conduct of remedial and other classes this summer in public elementary and high schools, according to the Department of Education

item.title: House leaders file P1.5 trillion economic stimulus bill
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano and other House leaders yesterday filed a bill setting a P1.5-trillion stimulus program to jumpstart the country’s economy severely affected by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Duterte consoles mothers of frontliners who died of COVID
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte consoled mothers of frontliners who died fighting the coronavirus pandemic, saying their children offered their lives to save others from the disease.

item.title: CSC suggests ‘sleep at work’ for state workers
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: The Civil Service Commission yesterday urged the heads of government agencies from national offices down to local government units to consider “sleep at work” arrangements for state workers.

item.title: DOLE: 2.5 million workers displaced by COVID pandemic
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: An estimated 2.5 million workers nationwide have been displaced due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, the Department of Labor and Employment said yesterday.

item.title: DOH: Current testing capacity for COVID-19 at 8,000
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health is eyeing at least 28,000 daily testing capacity to contain the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) by June, or right after the modified enhanced community quarantine is lifted in Metro Manila and other virus-affected areas, Secretary Francisco Duque III said.

item.title: SMC swabbing booths to boost testing for barangays, frontliners
item.description: San Miguel Corp. has teamed up with 17 local government units in Metro Manila to put up more testing booths in areas with high-density of COVID-19 cases as well as donate test kits to allow the poorest communities access to free testing.

item.title: ‘It’s time to promote cycling culture in Philippines’
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: With the restrictions in transportation still in effect in most parts of the Philippines due to the coronavirus disease 2019 outbreak, a cycling enthusiast has pushed for the promotion of a “cycling culture” in the country.

item.title: Teacher who offered P50 million for Duterte slay arrested
item.author: Eva Visperas
item.description: Elements of the National Bureau of Investigation Dagupan District Office have arrested a teacher who offered a P50-million bounty on his Twitter account to anyone who would kill President Duterte.

item.title: Experts find alarming errors in DOH patient data
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Experts from the University of the Philippines have discovered “alarming errors” in the data released by the Department of Health on coronavirus patients.
